attributes.action: In a government leadership contest for PM a general election should be called
attributes.additional_details: Too often governments have changed Prime Minister within their term of office after considerable infighting. This is a distraction from real events that need urgent government attention. The new PM has not been voted into office. If a leadership contest for PM ocurres then MPs will think twice about a leadership contest if it means triggering a general election. All the unelected PMs have caused considerable issues such as May, Truss, and soon Starmer! Government has stopped governing!
attributes.background: If a government elects a new PM mid term then a general election should be called. The new incumbent has not been voted for and infighting is happening too much.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/737933
